intro: Anisophyllea mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbensis Anisophyllea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
